reviews.content:
On behalf of my brother,  we want to say a big thank you to HNF for their home therapy service.  Through AIC,  we were contacted by HNF physiotherapist Kyi Kyi for my brother’s weekly home-based physio sessions.  She is very patient, encouraging and  respectful towards my brother.  She even borrowed from one of her patients a leg exercise machine for my brother to try before we buy online.  Also helped us to arrange HNF healthcare colleague to do assessment for the Disability scheme, SG Enable Carpark Label for Passengers with Mobility Impairment and referred him to St Luke Eldercare for his future physio sessions.

HNF is a one-stop all-round service provider who brings care into the homes of patient.  Their comprehensive range of services make it easier for  caregivers to tap on.  We appreciate their service.
We have been getting home visit service for more than a year from nurse Yee Ting Ting. She has been so helpful and listen to our problem. Her cheerful personality is a major plus. Thank you ting ting

My mum has bedsore wound at her tailbone so we were so lost and do not know how to handle or what to buy.  Lucky we received help from Ktph nurse Fasila who apply to HNF to assist us.  Hence today Vanessa came with her team and teaches us, helped us with all our questions and also her expertise calm our anxiety and also let us know they are there for us .  My mum is so blessed to have all these wonderful angels coming to help her .  Thank you to all these wonderful and beautiful people!

We are so grateful to Home Nursing, Nurse Sara who was so helpful and patience in attending to my late mother. Especially during that time when we are stretched not knowing how to response to my late mother's condition. Sara is a very dedicated and committed health worker. She even responded to our help during her off duty hours. I want to thank Home Nursing for journeying with us during the final days of my mom's life. I believe Home Nursing is a great blessing to our aging society.

Highly professional and knowledgeable healthcare providers touch with compassion who follows thru on all my requests promptly. They truly attended to all my fathers needs whilst he was convalescing at home. Instills great confidence to caregivers like me who depends on their support to look after our loved ones.

name: Care Corner Active Ageing Centre - Care (TP131)
Care Corner Senior Care Centre (Toa Payoh West)

reviews.content:
My mum and I would like to pen this Appreciation Note to you and your staff.

As I am serving my notice at work and being the only child, it has been comforting that for the past 3 weeks, your staff has helped my mum cross over to the opposite road for her to catch the bus home.

Appreciated much the act of kindness from your staff.

Dad has been attending Care Corner rehab and day care services for several years now. He always looks forward to the warm greetings and familiar faces of the dedicated staff, whom he knows not just by sight, but by name and even a bit of their personal stories. It's truly heartwarming to witness the bond he has formed with them over time, a testament to the caring and supportive environment they have cultivated. Dad's enthusiasm for these visits speaks volumes about the positive impact they have on his well-being and sense of belonging. He often shares stories about his interactions with the staff, highlighting the kindness and compassion they consistently demonstrate. In many ways, Care Corner has become a second home for Dad, a place where he feels welcomed, understood, and valued. We are immensely grateful for the unwavering support and care he receives from the entire team. Thank you!
Fun, engaging senior care centre
Are you open on public holidays?

Everywhere there are reviews about the elderly but they are all just nato or no talk only or even used as a place to make money.
Hi friends, one day you will be elderly like us.
In the future you will also feel how difficult it is when we are ravaged by age and disease.
What does it feel like when the body parts don't want to cooperate, like trembling fingers when we want to lift our drinking glass.
Keep that in mind.
We, the elderly community of Indonesia, send our greetings and prayers.
We will use the assistance we receive for the benefit of the elderly around us.

SATA Jurong Medical Center is only a 3-minute walk from Jurong East MRT. Take Exit A from the MRT station, follow the path, and cross the road. Once across, you'll spot a Cheers convenience store. Continue walking straight until you come across a self-photo booth. On your right, you’ll find a lift—take it to the 4th floor, and you'll arrive at the SATA clinic.
The staffs are very welcoming, polite, and attentive. Upon arriving at the SATA clinic, first proceed to the registration desk and follow the staff's guidance. After registering, you'll receive a queue number. Wait for your number to appear on the TV screen, then head to the counter displayed on the screen.
Remember to bring your NRIC or permit card when you visit the clinic.
All the staffs are ready to help you.

Have unpleasant experience Today Morning

Even though the receptionist staffs are friendly and helpful but the Doctor is not being professional based on what my experienced.
I has constipation since last year. Last night I had blood in my stool and pain in my anus when I was using toilet. That’s why I was worried and decided to see doctor. As I am foreign worker and  have to go SATA appointed by company , to get medical consultation for my heath issue. I went there and met the doctor. I am not sure what is her name and her room no is room 11.
She asked me what happened and what did you eat . Okay that’s normal things when we meet with doctors. I told her what I ate and
what happened to me last night. She asked me how many litters of water you drink per day and did you do my exercise? I told her I drink 2-3 L per day and I exercise as well. She asked what kind of exercise did you do? I said light cardio and yoga .Then
She checked my butt and situation. I was worried that I am having a hemorrhoids . As I can feel something that come out from my anus.
She just check and never told me properly why I  am having this problems.
I asked her what should I do should I do more exercise ? she said I aldy asked you like did you do exercise or not so my answer is there . And gave me one liquid that will help for constipation.
We need doctors for our worries about our health if we can solve ourselves why should we go the clinics ? Please be professional and treat your patient with abit care and kind . That’s doctors should do for people health.
I am sure that I won’t go there again for my sickness or other health problems expect medical check test appointed my company.
In this case, I will go other clinics and seek advice for my problem.
I asked her to give me medical certificate as I couldn’t go back to work as the time is about 12:30 pm. Okay I understand that you can’t give me as I am not sick . But she  can tell me easily way right? when I go and ask her she said can’t give and asked me to leave from her room with rude way.
For those who are reading my review, PLEASE DO NOT GO THERE TO SEEK YOUR MEDICAL ADVICE. Health is important to us hence please go to clinic which have professional doctors and good doctors.
I didn’t come as I want to get fake MC, I came as I am worry about my health I just want to check whether I am having hemorrhoids or not and I  wanted to know how to avoid that.
Very organized and swift. I got my pre-emp checkup done in less than 1 hr. Thanks for Ms Chiang Sui Len and the staffs at room 8. All are friendly and helpful.

Went to SATA today for Colour Vision Test for Application to Singapore Poly. Waiting time was over 1 hour, but I was fine with this. Only can say that the staff at the queue counter was polite and understanding. After my number is called, I went to the registration part. I said that all I needed was to complete the form and get it signed. She was unsure and said 'let me check' and went to ask other colleague. Came back later and say this 'this one need doctor'. I didn't think much and just said oh ok. Later i got called up and went. The person gave me colour vision test and visual acuity test. After finish she told me to go to the counter to pay, I checked the form and found out that she only filled up the section for (with artificial aids) and did not fill up section for (without artificial aids) so I went back and told them. After that, it was done and told me to go to pay. I went to the payment there and they checked the form and said needed signature so i went back to the person testing me for the 3rd time. Since she's testing other people, i waited and waited and one other colleague ask me whats the problem and i said no signature and she saw my form and said this one wait for number to get called then go sign. So my number got called and I went in to room 11. The person told me to sit down and i gave her the form. All she did was sign the form and stamp the form (even though she was not the person who tested me) and done. After I went to payment, The person said $55.90. I was shocked, I read lots of experience from other people and they said is was 10+ or 20+. I even gave my Blue CHAS Card and only got 10% discount. And I have no choice but to just pay. After I got the receipt, I was there was a section for Medical Consultation for $28??? So you're telling me I am paying $28 for one little stamp and signature from a person who did not even test me??? There was no consultation involved and no consultation was even necessary. One of the most horrible experience ever. $28 gone in 2 minutes for stamping and signature. If you are going for colour vision test for poly, REMEMBER!!! TELL THEM YOU DO NOT NEED AND DO NOT WANT A DOCTOR/MEDICAL CONSULTATION!

I was sent by my company for a medical checkup. My son told me not to go to Jurong SATA because of the seemingly not so good reviews. I went there anyway.

However, my visit to Jurong SATA yesterday morning turned out to be a pleasant one. The environment is neat and clean. The staff there are friendly and helpful. In particular, I would like to commend Ms Chiang Sui Len. She is courteous, friendly, helpful and patient in explaining my queries. Thank you, Ms Chiang for your outstanding service!

Kwong Wai Shiu Hospital Canteen, 705 Serangoon Road.

Kwong Wai Shiu hospital canteen. I, Sylvia Ang, known as Lay Kheng Ang. Tried the Chinese Popiah at Kwong Wai Sjiu hospital Canteen.The staff add mock vegetarian chilly pork sauce, celery, carrot, lecttuce. Roll the Popiah. It's ok done. Cut it $3 each. I was given a plastic hand glove to hold the Popiah while eating. Happy eating. I did come back again. Do not hesitate to recommend this Popiah. Rating 5.
Very lousy services.  Since june till now. REFUSED TO GIVE ME MY ITEMS, DEMANDS DELIVERY FEES 163.00 ASK MANY QUESTIONS AND FORMS WHICH WERE GIVEN TO AIC. And refuse to pass me.
I went to the TCM in there. The reception are aunties but they are good and helpful. The ladies doctor is very good and patience.
It was very hot and alot of people there but good experience with friends
Please note the timings are for visitation hours and not to be confused with office hours.

Really enjoyed volunteering under the meals on wheels program.  The coordinators are friendly and accommodating. Its easy to become a volunteer and book our available schedule via their app. Even if we don't have a vehicle, we can still take up slots for walkers. Very convenient and flexible mode of volunteering that suits those who are busy. Wish there would be more volunteers for jurong area to ease the delivery load!

The friendly full-time staff here are dedicated to facilitate the volunteering experience. I helped with food delivery to senior residents who are incapacitated or needy. There are two slots a day, lunch and dinner delivery, for 9-12pm or 3-6pm. Slots are open every day and flexible for those who would like to make good use of their time to help those in need.
Full of nice, friendly and dedicated people. One may volunteer for meals delivery service for elderly recipients.
Good place to go for volunteering to help the community.

Sent the registration form in for Meals on Wheels in may. As of mid oct, ive not received a reply. Called 4 times to different hotlines, each hotline directing me to a different hotline. From the prev conversation, ive understood that they would chase the admin to rectify from their side. Guess what? Nothing has been done. Has the admin been on a month holiday or what?

Always lack of volunteers but no action to recruit people who actually interested to volunteer

If volunteering recruit is so hard i think my mission to conquer the Great Wall of China would have been a breeze for me. Then, back to waiting for their reply.

Try other intiatives instead, hopefully their admins are actually doing their work!
Staff vaccany available sir
Please keep the feedback going ! Thanks a lot
The way they treat volunteers are like free labours, take things for granted with no appreciation...
This charity benefits and helps the less fortunate
Nice n friendly staffs.
Volunteer for Touch-MealonWheels
Helping the community!

We engaged Jaga-Me for their home health screening service at the comfort of our home. A big compliments to nurse fiona whom is very experience in taking blood as we had very traumatic experiences before as my veins are small and deep inside.But senior nurse Fiona managed to draw blood at the first try with no fuss and stress!  Recommended!
really grateful to all the nurses that helped me with my IV drip these past few days, especially Janet

I am thoroughly impressed with the professionalism of Nurse Vivi from Jaga-me. She cared for my wife with an exceptional level of dedication, patience, and, most importantly, genuine compassion. She’s truly a breath of fresh air in the field of healthcare.

Nurse Vivi not only provided top-notch care but also showed ingenuity by improvising certain tools to make our daily tasks easier. Her invaluable advice and practical tips made a significant difference in our daily routines. What sets her apart is her willingness to go the extra mile to ensure everything is taken care of. We are immensely grateful for her outstanding service and the genuine kindness she brought to our home.
Lady manning the hotline is the most horrendous. Kept saying don't know and hanging up the call 3 times.

Would like to thank Dr Cindy Yeo for accepting up my last minute emergency case (accepted my request within 30 minutes) last week as I tried to request a house call doctor on other platforms but they did not get back to me. Dr Yeo and her team was very helpful and professional in handling my case. Highly recommend Jaga-Me! Really appreciated the prompt response from the coordinator and the medical team 🙏

Bought total of 180hrs care pro package to take over my helper on home leave. It was great that homage arranged the same care pro personnel for the 15 days, 12hrs per day. Care pro Romeo Huang was professional, on time n took good care of my elderly needs. Highly recommended.

It is unethical to profit off the elderly and special needs.

Homage whatsapp service is manned by a bot and the emergency line takes up to 1 hour to respond.

Homage did not screen their caregivers with 1 of them even writing she used a cloth meant for cleaning a child's toys to clean the sofa to put her belongings (including her used mask) after removing the toys to put on the floor! She even used the fan to blow at herself. For 8 hours she did that and also to knock on the child's bedroom to ask to be let into the AC room even though the child repeatedly asked her to go wipe his toys in the living room.

The child is smart enough to send a message and upon receiving it, the Homage team is informed as this care giver (not born and breed in SG) did informed that she is not allowed to use her mobile phone to contact the mother as Homage banned their caregivers from contacting the clients as there are caregivers who skipped the agent Homage and just provide service to the client at a cheaper rate as Homage did take a sizeable commission from these caregivers.

It is incredible this caregiver can write in her report the child refused food but she didn't contact the mother (and Homage) and this is an 8 hours assignment.

When checked with Homage, Homage respond was they are not responsible for any incident between Homage care givers and care recipients- be it with a family present or left alone with a Homage care giver.

100% unprofessional not responsible and illogical. Not recommended at all, even when it is offered free.

I am an active CarePro who’s unable to reach out or speak to any support representative/team for an issue I need help resolving.

I have reached out twice to in-app support. three emails. two phone calls. no response and only automated feedback was given. whatsapp hotline has been removed months ago.

this is extremely frustrating. please reach out to me personally.

Update:
They reached out to me the next day BUT went missing again the day after, leaving me hanging with no updates or resolution. The issue is simple and can be easily resolved. PLEASE get back to me ASAP.

I joined on the 16 may 2024 . Total there are 10 trips within a month , last trip was on 12 June 2025, I should get the $80 incentives .
Emailed them and the person in charge kept telling I only hit 9 trips . Evidence are there but kept telling me I hit 9 trips only .

The homage system are screwed up very badly , it’s more liked a scam app . We work so hard for the incentives yet they still tell me this kind of excuses hence I am super disappointed. If you guys unable to give out the $80 incentives can just say it out.

An unauthorized deduction was made on my credit card for a service not rendered. It has taken months of intensive followup and discussion for Homage to be willing to refund the unauthorized deductions.

It was my second time engaging i-Kare and both times I were very thankful for their efficiency and professionalism. Both times different requirements and they did not disappoint. The staff were very kind, attentive and patient. They would go beyond their responsibilities and ensure the care provided was of quality. A thank you to Diana and team. Your company will be highly recommended to my circle of friends!

Had to book an urgent appointment for my mum. Kare manager Phyllis and Evelyn were very helpful and promptly arranged the home visit. Nurses were very professional and friendly. Special compliments to nurse Karina, she was very cheerful and caring  and she really made my mum feel much better! Highly recommend i-kare for their professional and caring service!

Has engaged their service for NG tube re-insertion for my dad recently.
Would like to thanks Diana (care manager) who managed to find Sandy (nurse) within a short period of time.
Sandy is meticulous and patient.  She gave our helper some caregiver training and also share some tips on how to make my dad feels more comfortable. Thumbs up for her services.

iKare has been of great help when I had made a last minute call for assistance for a caregiver to take care of my mum. Sanjay has been very patient and accommodating to my last minute requests. I am thankful for all the help and services that were extended to me and my family.

Ikare did a very good job of providing companionship for my mil over 2 weeks when her helper when on home leave. We noticed that my mil alertness and mobility improved with the exercises initiated by the caregiver and from the caregiver’s companionship.

On my last visit to Singapore, I was a bit apprehensive because being a stroke survivor from Australia, I was accustomed to daily showers and care from my Ndis support workers.
I reached out to Reuben from Home Instead who accommodated to my requests. I was pleasantly surprised by the carer, Khin and Berenice who were caring and helped me even with my walks and exercise.
They were excellent and well matched to my needs.
Because of Home Instead’s services and Reuben’s help I would not hesitate recommending them.
I will definitely use again when I return to Singapore.

Got in touch with Reuben from Home Instead for the caregiving services for my sister. I appreciate that communications are personalised, prompt, and human-to human. In order to fit our needs, Reuben had to reschedule the roster of his caregivers, which I am extremely grateful and thankful for. Unfortunately, despite all Reuben had done for us, we ultimately did not utilize the services he had arranged, due to my sister's untimely passing. Special thanks to Berenice (the contracted caregiver) and Jamaliyah (the nurse) who stayed on with me on the day I was told my sister would not make it past the weekend. They offered much comfort and companionship during a very difficult time. I wholeheartedly recommend Home Instead for their reliable, well-coordinated, and personalised services.

Reuben and team provide a much needed niche service which enable many to continue living their lives as fully as possible and remaining in their own homes.
Having used another similar practice, I can state that Home Instead provides a much more personal service and communications are directly with a human (no call centre or messages via an app), more often than not, the boss himself.
I really appreciate the level of kindness and professionalism and am beyond grateful.

Hi Irene & team, since 16 April 2021, my mum and family have enjoyed excellent caregiving services from your care professionals, especially on short notice for urgent needs. I especially want to thank Cindy who has been always there for my mum on the days my mum's helper is not around. We look forward to having Cindy with us in 2023 too!

The team is responsive and professional. They also strive for quality and always deliver with excellent services. I like the personal touch and assignment of caregiver which caters to our needs. The team regularly update us on my grandmother's condition even though she was under the care of few caregivers. I highly recommend Home Instead to those who are in need of caregiver.

Comfort Keepers is the best company that I have dealt with. The nurses are highly professional, knowledgeable, confident and most important of all exceedingly competent. I have been getting its services for the past two years, and my 85-year-old mother and my family are very pleased with it. Sister Hoon in particular has been very helpful, prompt and dutiful. She has never disappointed us whenever we approach her at the eleventh hour. She always has solutions for every last-minute arrangements and requests. I highly recommend Comfort Keepers to anyone who looks for professionalism, safety, competence and reliability.

Would like to thank Nurse Joon for providing her advice on how we can better manage our mum. Also , caregiver Geok Hua for her patience and dedication to assist our mum. She has made our mum happy that she is willing to do colouring, something she has refused doing for very long time. 🤎

I didn’t plan to write a review but after writing in to management with my heartfelt feedback and only receiving a short canned response, I felt it was warranted.

I engaged CK for my terminally ill grandma who also has dementia symptoms. The carer, Angeline, quit on her 2nd day after my grandma criticised her for putting on a BP monitor cuff wrongly. While I know it must have been unpleasant for Angeline to face that, the fact that she quit so easily after just 1 or 2 statements from an elderly person with dementia makes me feel that she wasn’t well trained and unsuitable for this job. Not to make excuses for my grandma, but this is expected behaviour from dementia patients and Angeline was briefed about this beforehand.

Also, despite giving a weeks notice the scheduling of the carers is left to the very last minute, literally the night before the carer is meant to come in and this is not communicated clearly and transparently to the client unless you specifically ask about it. When I mentioned that I should’ve been informed if there is no confirmed carer so that I can make other arrangements, Nurse Joon (who was in charge of carer allocation and scheduling) raised her voice at me over the phone, told me it is not her fault as she has been busy, and that if she is unable to allocate a carer it is our own responsibility as family members to care for my grandma. To me this shows a lack of sympathy towards clients and our needs. It is precisely because we as family know we are unable to meet the needs of my grandma that we engaged your services so to suggest that we need to take more responsibility is baffling to me. Furthermore, how are we supposed to take leave or arrange to work from home if you only inform us the night before?

It’s because of this very regretful experience that I am leaving a public review and due to the fact that they made our lives tougher during an already tough time when they were supposed to provide assistance. Unless huge improvements are made to the company’s SOP and service attitude I would recommend against engaging their services.

THINK TWICE BEFORE ENGAGE COMFORT KEEPERS (NOBLE CARE PTE LTD)

I engaged comfort keepers to provide caregiver service to my dad. I have listed out all the requirements to Joon (the PIC of the company) and I highlighted the most importantant thing is need to perform suctioning of Phlegm to my dad through mouth.

Joon told me that she will send the caregiver (we named it as Amy*) to the hospital (which my dad was staying) for a REFRESH course of the suctioning skill. After two time of lessons, Amy is still not very confident to do. I believed that the more frequent you do, the skill will be improved. So I decided to give Amy a chance.
*** At the later part, which when Amy came to my house, she told me she only did one time suctioning before that happened 5 years ago. This is totally different from what Joon told me. GOSH!!

After my dad discharge, Joon came to my house to do a house assessment before the service start. I double check with Joon, as Amy is very small in size and close to  60years old, will she be  suitable to take care of my dad alone (eg: turning my dad around, etc). Joon replied with everything ok and no issue.

Well, the nightmare started. The first 3 days, Amy still can’t do well on suctioning part and I can’t leave the house for work, as I need to be around to watch her do.

After the first week, I feedback to Joon, Amy is still not confident in this area (sunctioning of phlegm) and I will still need to guide her. Joon acknowledged my feedback and said will talk to Amy. After Joon talk to Amy, Amy dosent  seem to improve, therefore I decided to close one eye as long as my dad breathing is stable.

However, what happened next was, during the official working time, Amy was caught by me through the CCTV a few times that she was sleeping. The guardrail of my dad bed was not close up. It is very dangerous as what if when Amy really fell in deep sleep and my dad fell down from the bed? How?!

I showed the video and feedback to Joon on Amy sleeping issue as it happened again ( I have videos to proof). This has really hit my limit and I decided to end the contact immediately.

The reason why I engaged comfort keepers services is to help me reduce my burden and can allow me to go out to work peacefully without worrying for my dad. However, this company really disappointed me with their service from the start to the end. On the later part, when I want to terminate the contract and I informed Joon. I shared to Joon on my concern and reason why I choose to terminate the contract early, Joon totally ignored my feedback and message. Joon replied me after one month later and asking me about the payment (I have not settle the payment cause I am waiting for a reasonable reply on the incident happened).

I am not a person who will review a negative feedback, however, comfort keeper really is giving me headache from the start till the end and the service that I have encountered is very disappointing.

Please reconsider comfort keepers if you intend to ask them provide their service to you. Based on my experience, I totally DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Ps: if the management of comfort keepers is reading this, please review your caregiver and PIC standard. Thank you.

Ms Masturina is very gentle and empathetic when attending to both my parents during her weekly visit.  She is never in a rush and always gives a listening ear.

Issues raised with her are always addressed expeditiously. A professional.

She exudes very good vibes.  Much appreciated😊

Really thankful to Ms Masturina filled with appreciation for the incredible impact you make every visits.
Your kindness and empathy make a profound difference in the lives of patients and their families.
Thank you for your dedication, compassion & your unwavering commitment to patient well-being.

You have dedicated your lives in the medical field and helping others. We are so very grateful for that choice.

Much respect and gratefulness for what you do. Praying for God’s protection as you perform your selfless acts of love and caring.

Thank you Active Global Specialised Caregivers team!
I am very grateful to Maw Maw for her dedication and care for my mother throughout these 12 days. With her help and support, I felt more assured and relieved with professionals like her.
She has always been prompt and proactive to check with the health care professional for advice and keeping us well informed.
Once again, I am thankful to Maw Maw and team!
💐

I am very satisfied with the services provided by the following staff from Active Global: Nurse Zuhairah has been regularly visiting me. She is very helpful and understanding. She helps me at anytime when needed. She is also very kind and efficient. She provides me with information about my medications and answers questions about my health/condition. HPC Jessica does a very good job with housekeeping and is very punctual. Admin staff Fiona is very kind when attending to my concerns/needs even though it is only through the telephone. Thank you very much, I really appreciate all the help from Active Global.

Nurse Vicky was assigned to come over my mum hse weekly to check my dad’s condition who is a wheelchair bound patient.
I appreciate your tireless dedication and commitment to patient well-being. Thank you for always going above and beyond your amazing care by always putting your patients first. You are truly appreciated.
